metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4084 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer signedness error in epan/dissectors/packet-mswsp.c in the MS-WSPdissector in Wireshark 2.0.x before 2.0.3 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (integer overflow and application crash) via a craftedpacket that triggers an unexpected array size.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4084` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1').
